00005 #ifndef __ROUTING_H
00006 #define __ROUTING_H
00007 
00008 /*
00009  * structures containing global routing information for the partitioned network
00010  */
00011 
00012 typedef struct _ROUTING_CHANNEL
00013 {
00014    int length;         /* approx. channel length in gridpoints */
00015    int ncells;         /* width of this channel [# basic cells] */
00016    int nwires;         /* number of wires in the channel */
00017 }
00018 ROUTING_CHANNEL, *ROUTING_CHANNELPTR;
00019 
00020 
00021 typedef struct _ROUTING_INFO
00022 {
00023    ROUTING_CHANNEL channel[2];    /* channel[HOR] and channel[VER] are legal */
00024 }
00025 ROUTING_INFO, *ROUTING_INFOPTR;
00026 
00027 
00028 typedef struct _GLOBAL_ROUTING
00029 {
00030    /* each element in the small_channels matrix contains info about the
00031     * vertical channel to the right of partition [x][y] and the horizontal
00032     * channel to the top of partition [x][y]:
00033     */
00034    ROUTING_INFO **small_channels; /* range is [0..nx-2][0..ny-2] */
00035    /* following two arrays contain info about channels that partition the
00036     * entire placement in two pieces. The vertical channel that sits between
00037     * the partitions [i,i+1][y] is contained in vertical_channel[i] and the
00038     * info about the horizontal channel that sits between [x][j,j+1] is
00039     * contained in horizontal_channel[j]. Counting starts at 0:
00040     */
00041    ROUTING_CHANNEL *horizontal_channels; /* range is [0..ny-2] */
00042    ROUTING_CHANNEL *vertical_channels;   /* range is [0..nx-2] */
00043 }
00044 GLOBAL_ROUTING, *GLOBAL_ROUTINGPTR;
00045 
00046 
00047 #endif /* __ROUTING_H */
